text:
Blessed is the man
    who walks not in the counsel of the wicked,
nor stands in the way of sinners,
    nor sits in the seat of scoffers;
speaker: Narrator

text:
but his delight is in the law of the Lord,
    and on his law he meditates day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is like a tree
    planted by streams of water
that yields its fruit in its season,
    and its leaf does not wither.
In all that he does, he prospers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are not so,
    but are like chaff that the wind drives away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgement,
    nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous;
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the Lord knows the way of the righteous,
    but the way of the wicked will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do the nations rage
    and the peoples plot in vain?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings of the earth set themselves,
    and the rulers take counsel together,
    against the Lord and against his Anointed, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Let us burst their bonds apart
    and cast away their cords from us.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who sits in the heavens laughs;
    the Lord holds them in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he will speak to them in his wrath,
    and terrify them in his fury, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“As for me, I have set my King
    on Zion, my holy hill.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Ask of me, and I will make the nations your heritage,
    and the ends of the earth your possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall break them with a rod of iron
    and dash them in pieces like a potter's vessel.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now therefore, O kings, be wise;
    be warned, O rulers of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Serve the Lord with fear,
    and rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kiss the Son,
    lest he be angry, and you perish in the way,
    for his wrath is quickly kindled.
Blessed are all who take refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, how many are my foes!
    Many are rising against me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
many are saying of my soul,
    there is no salvation for him in God. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, are a shield about me,
    my glory, and the lifter of my head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried aloud to the Lord,
    and he answered me from his holy hill. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lay down and slept;
    I woke again, for the Lord sustained me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not be afraid of many thousands of people
    who have set themselves against me all round.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord!
    Save me, O my God!
For you strike all my enemies on the cheek;
    you break the teeth of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Salvation belongs to the Lord;
    your blessing be on your people! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness!
    You have given me relief when I was in distress.
    Be gracious to me and hear my prayer!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O men, how long shall my honour be turned into shame?
    How long will you love vain words and seek after lies? Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
But know that the Lord has set apart the godly for himself;
    the Lord hears when I call to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be angry, and do not sin;
    ponder in your own hearts on your beds, and be silent. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer right sacrifices,
    and put your trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There are many who say, “Who will show us some good?
    Lift up the light of your face upon us, O Lord!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have put more joy in my heart
    than they have when their grain and wine abound.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In peace I will both lie down and sleep;
    for you alone, O Lord, make me dwell in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give ear to my words, O Lord;
    consider my groaning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give attention to the sound of my cry,
    my King and my God,
    for to you do I pray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, in the morning you hear my voice;
    in the morning I prepare a sacrifice for you and watch.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are not a God who delights in wickedness;
    evil may not dwell with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The boastful shall not stand before your eyes;
    you hate all evildoers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You destroy those who speak lies;
    the Lord abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I, through the abundance of your steadfast love,
    will enter your house.
I will bow down towards your holy temple
    in the fear of you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For you bless the righteous, O Lord;
    you cover him with favour as with a shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, rebuke me not in your anger,
    nor discipline me in your wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am languishing;
    heal me, O Lord, for my bones are troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul also is greatly troubled.
    But you, O Lord—how long?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn, O Lord, deliver my life;
    save me for the sake of your steadfast love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For in death there is no remembrance of you;
    in Sheol who will give you praise?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My eye wastes away because of grief;
    it grows weak because of all my foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from me, all you workers of evil,
    for the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has heard my plea;
    the Lord accepts my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All my enemies shall be ashamed and greatly troubled;
    they shall turn back and be put to shame in a moment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, in you do I take refuge;
    save me from all my pursuers and deliver me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
lest like a lion they tear my soul apart,
    rending it in pieces, with none to deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, if I have done this,
    if there is wrong in my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if I have repaid my friend with evil
    or plundered my enemy without cause,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let the assembly of the peoples be gathered about you;
    over it return on high.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Oh, let the evil of the wicked come to an end,
    and may you establish the righteous—
you who test the minds and hearts,
    O righteous God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My shield is with God,
    who saves the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is a righteous judge,
    and a God who feels indignation every day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If a man does not repent, God will whet his sword;
    he has bent and readied his bow;
speaker: Narrator

text:
he has prepared for him his deadly weapons,
    making his arrows fiery shafts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, the wicked man conceives evil
    and is pregnant with mischief
    and gives birth to lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes a pit, digging it out,
    and falls into the hole that he has made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mischief returns upon his own head,
    and on his own skull his violence descends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give to the Lord the thanks due to his righteousness,
    and I will sing praise to the name of the Lord, the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, our Lord,
    how majestic is your name in all the earth!
You have set your glory above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of the mouth of babies and infants,
you have established strength because of your foes,
    to still the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers,
    the moon and the stars, which you have set in place,
speaker: Narrator

text:
what is man that you are mindful of him,
    and the son of man that you care for him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you have made him a little lower than the heavenly beings
    and crowned him with glory and honour.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given him dominion over the works of your hands;
    you have put all things under his feet,
speaker: Narrator

text:
all sheep and oxen,
    and also the beasts of the field,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the birds of the heavens, and the fish of the sea,
    whatever passes along the paths of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, our Lord,
    how majestic is your name in all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart;
    I will recount all of your wonderful deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be glad and exult in you;
    I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When my enemies turn back,
    they stumble and perish before your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have maintained my just cause;
    you have sat on the throne, giving righteous judgement.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have rebuked the nations; you have made the wicked perish;
    you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But the Lord sits enthroned for ever;
    he has established his throne for justice,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and he judges the world with righteousness;
    he judges the peoples with uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is a stronghold for the oppressed,
    a stronghold in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And those who know your name put their trust in you,
    for you, O Lord, have not forsaken those who seek you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to the Lord, who sits enthroned in Zion!
    Tell among the peoples his deeds!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he who avenges blood is mindful of them;
    he does not forget the cry of the afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be gracious to me, O Lord!
    See my affliction from those who hate me,
    O you who lift me up from the gates of death,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I may recount all your praises,
    that in the gates of the daughter of Zion
    I may rejoice in your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations have sunk in the pit that they made;
    in the net that they hid, their own foot has been caught.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has made himself known; he has executed judgement;
    the wicked are snared in the work of their own hands. Higgaion. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked shall return to Sheol,
    all the nations that forget God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the needy shall not always be forgotten,
    and the hope of the poor shall not perish for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord! Let not man prevail;
    let the nations be judged before you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put them in fear, O Lord!
    Let the nations know that they are but men! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why, O Lord, do you stand far away?
    Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text:
In arrogance the wicked hotly pursue the poor;
    let them be caught in the schemes that they have devised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the wicked boasts of the desires of his soul,
    and the one greedy for gain curses and renounces the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the pride of his face the wicked does not seek him;
    all his thoughts are, “There is no God.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved;
    throughout all generations I shall not meet adversity.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mouth is filled with cursing and deceit and oppression;
    under his tongue are mischief and iniquity.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
The helpless are crushed, sink down,
    and fall by his might.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten,
    he has hidden his face, he will never see it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up your hand;
    forget not the afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why does the wicked renounce God
    and say in his heart, “You will not call to account”?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Break the arm of the wicked and evildoer;
    call his wickedness to account till you find none.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is king for ever and ever;
    the nations perish from his land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you hear the desire of the afflicted;
    you will strengthen their heart; you will incline your ear
speaker: Narrator

text:
to do justice to the fatherless and the oppressed,
    so that man who is of the earth may strike terror no more.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
if the foundations are destroyed,
    what can the righteous do?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord tests the righteous,
    but his soul hates the wicked and the one who loves violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let him rain coals on the wicked;
    fire and sulphur and a scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Save, O Lord, for the godly one is gone;
    for the faithful have vanished from among the children of man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone utters lies to his neighbour;
    with flattering lips and a double heart they speak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord cut off all flattering lips,
    the tongue that makes great boasts,
speaker: Narrator

text:
those who say, “With our tongue we will prevail,
    our lips are with us; who is master over us?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The words of the Lord are pure words,
    like silver refined in a furnace on the ground,
    purified seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, O Lord, will keep them;
    you will guard us from this generation for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On every side the wicked prowl,
    as vileness is exalted among the children of man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord? Will you forget me for ever?
    How long will you hide your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long must I take counsel in my soul
    and have sorrow in my heart all the day?
How long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider and answer me, O Lord my God;
    light up my eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death,
speaker: Narrator

text:
lest my enemy say, “I have prevailed over him”,
    lest my foes rejoice because I am shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I have trusted in your steadfast love;
    my heart shall rejoice in your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord,
    because he has dealt bountifully with me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
    They are corrupt, they do abominable deeds,
    there is none who does good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord looks down from heaven on the children of man,
    to see if there are any who understand,
    who seek after God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Have they no knowledge, all the evildoers
    who eat up my people as they eat bread
    and do not call upon the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
There they are in great terror,
    for God is with the generation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You would shame the plans of the poor,
    but the Lord is his refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion!
    When the Lord restores the fortunes of his people,
    let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, who shall sojourn in your tent?
    Who shall dwell on your holy hill?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who walks blamelessly and does what is right
    and speaks truth in his heart;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
who does not put out his money at interest
    and does not take a bribe against the innocent.
He who does these things shall never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve me, O God, for in you I take refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I say to the Lord, “You are my Lord;
    I have no good apart from you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for the saints in the land, they are the excellent ones,
    in whom is all my delight.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord is my chosen portion and my cup;
    you hold my lot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lines have fallen for me in pleasant places;
    indeed, I have a beautiful inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I bless the Lord who gives me counsel;
    in the night also my heart instructs me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have set the Lord always before me;
    because he is at my right hand, I shall not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore my heart is glad, and my whole being rejoices;
    my flesh also dwells secure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will not abandon my soul to Sheol,
    or let your holy one see corruption.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hear a just cause, O Lord; attend to my cry!
    Give ear to my prayer from lips free of deceit!
speaker: Narrator

text:
From your presence let my vindication come!
    Let your eyes behold the right!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
With regard to the works of man, by the word of your lips
    I have avoided the ways of the violent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My steps have held fast to your paths;
    my feet have not slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I call upon you, for you will answer me, O God;
    incline your ear to me; hear my words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wondrously show your steadfast love,
    O Saviour of those who seek refuge
    from their adversaries at your right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me as the apple of your eye;
    hide me in the shadow of your wings,
speaker: Narrator

text:
from the wicked who do me violence,
    my deadly enemies who surround me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They close their hearts to pity;
    with their mouths they speak arrogantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have now surrounded our steps;
    they set their eyes to cast us to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is like a lion eager to tear,
    as a young lion lurking in ambush.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord! Confront him, subdue him!
    Deliver my soul from the wicked by your sword,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
As for me, I shall behold your face in righteousness;
    when I awake, I shall be satisfied with your likeness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love you, O Lord, my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer,
    my God, my rock, in whom I take refuge,
    my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised,
    and I am saved from my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cords of death encompassed me;
    the torrents of destruction assailed me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the cords of Sheol entangled me;
    the snares of death confronted me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my distress I called upon the Lord;
    to my God I cried for help.
From his temple he heard my voice,
    and my cry to him reached his ears.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
He bowed the heavens and came down;
    thick darkness was under his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rode on a cherub and flew;
    he came swiftly on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made darkness his covering, his canopy around him,
    thick clouds dark with water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of the brightness before him
    hailstones and coals of fire broke through his clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord also thundered in the heavens,
    and the Most High uttered his voice,
    hailstones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he sent out his arrows and scattered them;
    he flashed forth lightnings and routed them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the channels of the sea were seen,
    and the foundations of the world were laid bare
at your rebuke, O Lord,
    at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent from on high, he took me;
    he drew me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rescued me from my strong enemy
    and from those who hated me,
    for they were too mighty for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They confronted me in the day of my calamity,
    but the Lord was my support.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought me out into a broad place;
    he rescued me, because he delighted in me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord dealt with me according to my righteousness;
    according to the cleanness of my hands he rewarded me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have kept the ways of the Lord,
    and have not wickedly departed from my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all his rules were before me,
    and his statutes I did not put away from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was blameless before him,
    and I kept myself from my guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the Lord has rewarded me according to my righteousness,
    according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the merciful you show yourself merciful;
    with the blameless man you show yourself blameless;
speaker: Narrator

text:
with the purified you show yourself pure;
    and with the crooked you make yourself seem tortuous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you save a humble people,
    but the haughty eyes you bring down.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it is you who light my lamp;
    the Lord my God lightens my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For by you I can run against a troop,
    and by my God I can leap over a wall.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For who is God, but the Lord?
    And who is a rock, except our God?—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the God who equipped me with strength
    and made my way blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made my feet like the feet of a deer
    and set me secure on the heights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He trains my hands for war,
    so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given me the shield of your salvation,
    and your right hand supported me,
    and your gentleness made me great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You gave a wide place for my steps under me,
    and my feet did not slip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pursued my enemies and overtook them,
    and did not turn back till they were consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I thrust them through, so that they were not able to rise;
    they fell under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you equipped me with strength for the battle;
    you made those who rise against me sink under me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made my enemies turn their backs to me,
    and those who hated me I destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried for help, but there was none to save;
    they cried to the Lord, but he did not answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I beat them fine as dust before the wind;
    I cast them out like the mire of the streets.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
As soon as they heard of me they obeyed me;
    foreigners came cringing to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Foreigners lost heart
    and came trembling out of their fortresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord lives, and blessed be my rock,
    and exalted be the God of my salvation—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the God who gave me vengeance
    and subdued peoples under me,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For this I will praise you, O Lord, among the nations,
    and sing to your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great salvation he brings to his king,
    and shows steadfast love to his anointed,
    to David and his offspring for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens declare the glory of God,
    and the sky above proclaims his handiwork.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day to day pours out speech,
    and night to night reveals knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no speech, nor are there words,
    whose voice is not heard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their voice goes out through all the earth,
    and their words to the end of the world.
In them he has set a tent for the sun,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which comes out like a bridegroom leaving his chamber,
    and, like a strong man, runs its course with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Its rising is from the end of the heavens,
    and its circuit to the end of them,
    and there is nothing hidden from its heat.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
the fear of the Lord is clean,
    enduring for ever;
the rules of the Lord are true,
    and righteous altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text:
More to be desired are they than gold,
    even much fine gold;
sweeter also than honey
    and drippings of the honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover, by them is your servant warned;
    in keeping them there is great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can discern his errors?
    Declare me innocent from hidden faults.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep back your servant also from presumptuous sins;
    let them not have dominion over me!
Then I shall be blameless,
    and innocent of great transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
    be acceptable in your sight,
    O Lord, my rock and my redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord answer you in the day of trouble!
    May the name of the God of Jacob protect you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he send you help from the sanctuary
    and give you support from Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he remember all your offerings
    and regard with favour your burnt sacrifices! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he grant you your heart's desire
    and fulfil all your plans!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May we shout for joy over your salvation,
    and in the name of our God set up our banners!
May the Lord fulfil all your petitions!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Some trust in chariots and some in horses,
    but we trust in the name of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They collapse and fall,
    but we rise and stand upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, save the king!
    May he answer us when we call.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, in your strength the king rejoices,
    and in your salvation how greatly he exults!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given him his heart's desire
    and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you meet him with rich blessings;
    you set a crown of fine gold upon his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked life of you; you gave it to him,
    length of days for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His glory is great through your salvation;
    splendour and majesty you bestow on him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you make him most blessed for ever;
    you make him glad with the joy of your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the king trusts in the Lord,
    and through the steadfast love of the Most High he shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hand will find out all your enemies;
    your right hand will find out those who hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will make them as a blazing oven
    when you appear.
The Lord will swallow them up in his wrath,
    and fire will consume them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will destroy their descendants from the earth,
    and their offspring from among the children of man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though they plan evil against you,
    though they devise mischief, they will not succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will put them to flight;
    you will aim at their faces with your bows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, O Lord, in your strength!
    We will sing and praise your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?
    Why are you so far from saving me, from the words of my groaning?
speaker: Narrator

text:
O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer,
    and by night, but I find no rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you are holy,
    enthroned on the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In you our fathers trusted;
    they trusted, and you delivered them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To you they cried and were rescued;
    in you they trusted and were not put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am a worm and not a man,
    scorned by mankind and despised by the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who see me mock me;
    they make mouths at me; they wag their heads;
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He trusts in the Lord; let him deliver him;
    let him rescue him, for he delights in him!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you are he who took me from the womb;
    you made me trust you at my mother's breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On you was I cast from my birth,
    and from my mother's womb you have been my God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Many bulls encompass me;
    strong bulls of Bashan surround me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they open wide their mouths at me,
    like a ravening and roaring lion.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I can count all my bones—
they stare and gloat over me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they divide my garments among them,
    and for my clothing they cast lots.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, do not be far off!
    O you my help, come quickly to my aid!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver my soul from the sword,
    my precious life from the power of the dog!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me from the mouth of the lion!
You have rescued me from the horns of the wild oxen!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will tell of your name to my brothers;
    in the midst of the congregation I will praise you:
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who fear the Lord, praise him!
    All you offspring of Jacob, glorify him,
    and stand in awe of him, all you offspring of Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has not despised or abhorred
    the affliction of the afflicted,
and he has not hidden his face from him,
    but has heard, when he cried to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From you comes my praise in the great congregation;
    my vows I will perform before those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
All the ends of the earth shall remember
    and turn to the Lord,
and all the families of the nations
    shall worship before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For kingship belongs to the Lord,
    and he rules over the nations.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Posterity shall serve him;
    it shall be told of the Lord to the coming generation;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they shall come and proclaim his righteousness to a people yet unborn,
    that he has done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes me lie down in green pastures.
He leads me beside still waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He restores my soul.
He leads me in paths of righteousness
    for his name's sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
    I will fear no evil,
for you are with me;
    your rod and your staff,
    they comfort me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me
    all the days of my life,
and I shall dwell in the house of the Lord
    for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth is the Lord's and the fullness thereof,
    the world and those who dwell therein,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for he has founded it upon the seas
    and established it upon the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who shall ascend the hill of the Lord?
    And who shall stand in his holy place?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
    who does not lift up his soul to what is false
    and does not swear deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will receive blessing from the Lord
    and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Such is the generation of those who seek him,
    who seek the face of the God of Jacob. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your heads, O gates!
    And be lifted up, O ancient doors,
    that the King of glory may come in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is this King of glory?
    The Lord, strong and mighty,
    the Lord, mighty in battle!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your heads, O gates!
    And lift them up, O ancient doors,
    that the King of glory may come in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is this King of glory?
    The Lord of hosts,
    he is the King of glory! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text: To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Indeed, none who wait for you shall be put to shame;
    they shall be ashamed who are wantonly treacherous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make me to know your ways, O Lord;
    teach me your paths.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Remember your mercy, O Lord, and your steadfast love,
    for they have been from of old.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Good and upright is the Lord;
    therefore he instructs sinners in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He leads the humble in what is right,
    and teaches the humble his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the paths of the Lord are steadfast love and faithfulness,
    for those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your name's sake, O Lord,
    pardon my guilt, for it is great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is the man who fears the Lord?
    Him will he instruct in the way that he should choose.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His soul shall abide in well-being,
    and his offspring shall inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The friendship of the Lord is for those who fear him,
    and he makes known to them his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are ever towards the Lord,
    for he will pluck my feet out of the net.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
    for I am lonely and afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The troubles of my heart are enlarged;
    bring me out of my distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider my affliction and my trouble,
    and forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider how many are my foes,
    and with what violent hatred they hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, guard my soul, and deliver me!
    Let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May integrity and uprightness preserve me,
    for I wait for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Redeem Israel, O God,
    out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Prove me, O Lord, and try me;
    test my heart and my mind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your steadfast love is before my eyes,
    and I walk in your faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do not sit with men of falsehood,
    nor do I consort with hypocrites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate the assembly of evildoers,
    and I will not sit with the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wash my hands in innocence
    and go round your altar, O Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
proclaiming thanksgiving aloud,
    and telling all your wondrous deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I love the habitation of your house
    and the place where your glory dwells.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not sweep my soul away with sinners,
    nor my life with bloodthirsty men,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in whose hands are evil devices,
    and whose right hands are full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity;
    redeem me, and be gracious to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My foot stands on level ground;
    in the great assembly I will bless the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When evildoers assail me
    to eat up my flesh,
my adversaries and foes,
    it is they who stumble and fall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though an army encamp against me,
    my heart shall not fear;
though war arise against me,
    yet I will be confident.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One thing have I asked of the Lord,
    that will I seek after:
that I may dwell in the house of the Lord
    all the days of my life,
to gaze upon the beauty of the Lord
    and to enquire in his temple.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And now my head shall be lifted up
    above my enemies all round me,
and I will offer in his tent
    sacrifices with shouts of joy;
I will sing and make melody to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, O Lord, when I cry aloud;
    be gracious to me and answer me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have said, “Seek my face.”
My heart says to you,
    “Your face, Lord, do I seek.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide not your face from me.
Turn not your servant away in anger,
    O you who have been my help.
Cast me not off; forsake me not,
    O God of my salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my father and my mother have forsaken me,
    but the Lord will take me in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me your way, O Lord,
    and lead me on a level path
    because of my enemies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I believe that I shall look upon the goodness of the Lord
    in the land of the living!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
To you, O Lord, I call;
    my rock, be not deaf to me,
lest, if you be silent to me,
    I become like those who go down to the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear the voice of my pleas for mercy,
    when I cry to you for help,
when I lift up my hands
    towards your most holy sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not drag me off with the wicked,
    with the workers of evil,
who speak peace with their neighbours
    while evil is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Because they do not regard the works of the Lord
    or the work of his hands,
he will tear them down and build them up no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord!
    For he has heard the voice of my pleas for mercy.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord is the strength of his people;
    he is the saving refuge of his anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, save your people and bless your heritage!
    Be their shepherd and carry them for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O heavenly beings,
    ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name;
    worship the Lord in the splendour of holiness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord is powerful;
    the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars;
    the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes Lebanon to skip like a calf,
    and Sirion like a young wild ox.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord flashes forth flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;
    the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord makes the deer give birth
    and strips the forests bare,
    and in his temple all cry, “Glory!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord sits enthroned over the flood;
    the Lord sits enthroned as king for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord give strength to his people!
    May the Lord bless his people with peace!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will extol you, O Lord, for you have drawn me up
    and have not let my foes rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, I cried to you for help,
    and you have healed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, you have brought up my soul from Sheol;
    you restored me to life from among those who go down to the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to the Lord, O you his saints,
    and give thanks to his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For his anger is but for a moment,
    and his favour is for a lifetime.
Weeping may tarry for the night,
    but joy comes with the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I said in my prosperity,
    “I shall never be moved.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
To you, O Lord, I cry,
    and to the Lord I plead for mercy:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“What profit is there in my death,
    if I go down to the pit?
Will the dust praise you?
    Will it tell of your faithfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, O Lord, and be merciful to me!
    O Lord, be my helper!”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
that my glory may sing your praise and not be silent.
    O Lord my God, I will give thanks to you for ever!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Incline your ear to me;
    rescue me speedily!
Be a rock of refuge for me,
    a strong fortress to save me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are my rock and my fortress;
    and for your name's sake you lead me and guide me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
you take me out of the net they have hidden for me,
    for you are my refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Into your hand I commit my spirit;
    you have redeemed me, O Lord, faithful God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate those who pay regard to worthless idols,
    but I trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
and you have not delivered me into the hand of the enemy;
    you have set my feet in a broad place.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For my life is spent with sorrow,
    and my years with sighing;
my strength fails because of my iniquity,
    and my bones waste away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of all my adversaries I have become a reproach,
    especially to my neighbours,
and an object of dread to my acquaintances;
    those who see me in the street flee from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have been forgotten like one who is dead;
    I have become like a broken vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I hear the whispering of many—
    terror on every side!—
as they scheme together against me,
    as they plot to take my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I trust in you, O Lord;
    I say, “You are my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My times are in your hand;
    rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from my persecutors!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make your face shine on your servant;
    save me in your steadfast love!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let the lying lips be mute,
    which speak insolently against the righteous
    in pride and contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, how abundant is your goodness,
    which you have stored up for those who fear you
and worked for those who take refuge in you,
    in the sight of the children of mankind!
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the cover of your presence you hide them
    from the plots of men;
you store them in your shelter
    from the strife of tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord,
    for he has wondrously shown his steadfast love to me
    when I was in a besieged city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I had said in my alarm,
    “I am cut off from your sight.”
But you heard the voice of my pleas for mercy
    when I cried to you for help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Love the Lord, all you his saints!
    The Lord preserves the faithful
    but abundantly repays the one who acts in pride.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be strong, and let your heart take courage,
    all you who wait for the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven,
    whose sin is covered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man against whom the Lord counts no iniquity,
    and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For when I kept silent, my bones wasted away
    through my groaning all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For day and night your hand was heavy upon me;
    my strength was dried up as by the heat of summer. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
I acknowledged my sin to you,
    and I did not cover my iniquity;
I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the Lord”,
    and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore let everyone who is godly
    offer prayer to you at a time when you may be found;
surely in the rush of great waters,
    they shall not reach him.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go;
    I will counsel you with my eye upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not like a horse or a mule, without understanding,
    which must be curbed with bit and bridle,
    or it will not stay near you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are the sorrows of the wicked,
    but steadfast love surrounds the one who trusts in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, O righteous,
    and shout for joy, all you upright in heart!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shout for joy in the Lord, O you righteous!
    Praise befits the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord with the lyre;
    make melody to him with the harp of ten strings!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him a new song;
    play skilfully on the strings, with loud shouts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the word of the Lord is upright,
    and all his work is done in faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He loves righteousness and justice;
    the earth is full of the steadfast love of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the word of the Lord the heavens were made,
    and by the breath of his mouth all their host.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gathers the waters of the sea as a heap;
    he puts the deeps in storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all the earth fear the Lord;
    let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he spoke, and it came to be;
    he commanded, and it stood firm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord brings the counsel of the nations to nothing;
    he frustrates the plans of the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The counsel of the Lord stands for ever,
    the plans of his heart to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord,
    the people whom he has chosen as his heritage!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord looks down from heaven;
    he sees all the children of man;
speaker: Narrator

text:
from where he sits enthroned he looks out
    on all the inhabitants of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he who fashions the hearts of them all
    and observes all their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king is not saved by his great army;
    a warrior is not delivered by his great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The war horse is a false hope for salvation,
    and by its great might it cannot rescue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, the eye of the Lord is on those who fear him,
    on those who hope in his steadfast love,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that he may deliver their soul from death
    and keep them alive in famine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our soul waits for the Lord;
    he is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our heart is glad in him,
    because we trust in his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your steadfast love, O Lord, be upon us,
    even as we hope in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless the Lord at all times;
    his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul makes its boast in the Lord;
    let the humble hear and be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, magnify the Lord with me,
    and let us exalt his name together!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I sought the Lord, and he answered me
    and delivered me from all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who look to him are radiant,
    and their faces shall never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him
    and saved him out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The angel of the Lord encamps
    round those who fear him, and delivers them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, taste and see that the Lord is good!
    Blessed is the man who takes refuge in him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, fear the Lord, you his saints,
    for those who fear him have no lack!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The young lions suffer want and hunger;
    but those who seek the Lord lack no good thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, O children, listen to me;
    I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What man is there who desires life
    and loves many days, that he may see good?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your tongue from evil
    and your lips from speaking deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away from evil and do good;
    seek peace and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of the Lord are towards the righteous
    and his ears towards their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The face of the Lord is against those who do evil,
    to cut off the memory of them from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the righteous cry for help, the Lord hears
    and delivers them out of all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is near to the broken-hearted
    and saves the crushed in spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
    but the Lord delivers him out of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He keeps all his bones;
    not one of them is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Affliction will slay the wicked,
    and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord redeems the life of his servants;
    none of those who take refuge in him will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Contend, O Lord, with those who contend with me;
    fight against those who fight against me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take hold of shield and buckler
    and rise for my help!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Draw the spear and javelin
    against my pursuers!
Say to my soul,
    “I am your salvation!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be put to shame and dishonour
    who seek after my life!
Let them be turned back and disappointed
    who devise evil against me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be like chaff before the wind,
    with the angel of the Lord driving them away!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their way be dark and slippery,
    with the angel of the Lord pursuing them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For without cause they hid their net for me;
    without cause they dug a pit for my life.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then my soul will rejoice in the Lord,
    exulting in his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All my bones shall say,
    “O Lord, who is like you,
delivering the poor
    from him who is too strong for him,
    the poor and needy from him who robs him?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Malicious witnesses rise up;
    they ask me of things that I do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They repay me evil for good;
    my soul is bereft.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
like profane mockers at a feast,
    they gnash at me with their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord, will you look on?
    Rescue me from their destruction,
    my precious life from the lions!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will thank you in the great congregation;
    in the mighty throng I will praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not those rejoice over me
    who are wrongfully my foes,
and let not those wink the eye
    who hate me without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they do not speak peace,
    but against those who are quiet in the land
    they devise words of deceit.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You have seen, O Lord; be not silent!
    O Lord, be not far from me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake and rouse yourself for my vindication,
    for my cause, my God and my Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vindicate me, O Lord, my God,
    according to your righteousness,
    and let them not rejoice over me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them not say in their hearts,
    “Aha, our heart's desire!”
Let them not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be put to shame and disappointed altogether
    who rejoice at my calamity!
Let them be clothed with shame and dishonour
    who magnify themselves against me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who delight in my righteousness
    shout for joy and be glad
    and say evermore,
“Great is the Lord,
    who delights in the welfare of his servant!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then my tongue shall tell of your righteousness
    and of your praise all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Transgression speaks to the wicked
    deep in his heart;
there is no fear of God
    before his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he flatters himself in his own eyes
    that his iniquity cannot be found out and hated.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of his mouth are trouble and deceit;
    he has ceased to act wisely and do good.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your steadfast love, O Lord, extends to the heavens,
    your faithfulness to the clouds.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
How precious is your steadfast love, O God!
    The children of mankind take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They feast on the abundance of your house,
    and you give them drink from the river of your delights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For with you is the fountain of life;
    in your light do we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, continue your steadfast love to those who know you,
    and your righteousness to the upright of heart!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not the foot of arrogance come upon me,
    nor the hand of the wicked drive me away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There the evildoers lie fallen;
    they are thrust down, unable to rise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fret not yourself because of evildoers;
    be not envious of wrongdoers!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they will soon fade like the grass
    and wither like the green herb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust in the Lord, and do good;
    dwell in the land and befriend faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Delight yourself in the Lord,
    and he will give you the desires of your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Commit your way to the Lord;
    trust in him, and he will act.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will bring forth your righteousness as the light,
    and your justice as the noonday.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Refrain from anger, and forsake wrath!
    Fret not yourself; it tends only to evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the evildoers shall be cut off,
    but those who wait for the Lord shall inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In just a little while, the wicked will be no more;
    though you look carefully at his place, he will not be there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the meek shall inherit the land
    and delight themselves in abundant peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked plots against the righteous
    and gnashes his teeth at him,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but the Lord laughs at the wicked,
    for he sees that his day is coming.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
their sword shall enter their own heart,
    and their bows shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is the little that the righteous has
    than the abundance of many wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
    but the Lord upholds the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord knows the days of the blameless,
    and their heritage will remain for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they are not put to shame in evil times;
    in the days of famine they have abundance.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The wicked borrows but does not pay back,
    but the righteous is generous and gives;
speaker: Narrator

text:
for those blessed by the Lord shall inherit the land,
    but those cursed by him shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The steps of a man are established by the Lord,
    when he delights in his way;
speaker: Narrator

text:
though he fall, he shall not be cast headlong,
    for the Lord upholds his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have been young, and now am old,
    yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken
    or his children begging for bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is ever lending generously,
    and his children become a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away from evil and do good;
    so shall you dwell for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord loves justice;
    he will not forsake his saints.
They are preserved for ever,
    but the children of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous shall inherit the land
    and dwell upon it for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
    and his tongue speaks justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The law of his God is in his heart;
    his steps do not slip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked watches for the righteous
    and seeks to put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will not abandon him to his power
    or let him be condemned when he is brought to trial.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have seen a wicked, ruthless man,
    spreading himself like a green laurel tree.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he passed away, and behold, he was no more;
    though I sought him, he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mark the blameless and behold the upright,
    for there is a future for the man of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But transgressors shall be altogether destroyed;
    the future of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The salvation of the righteous is from the Lord;
    he is their stronghold in the time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O Lord, rebuke me not in your anger,
    nor discipline me in your wrath!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your arrows have sunk into me,
    and your hand has come down on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no soundness in my flesh
    because of your indignation;
there is no health in my bones
    because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my iniquities have gone over my head;
    like a heavy burden, they are too heavy for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My wounds stink and fester
    because of my foolishness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am utterly bowed down and prostrate;
    all the day I go about mourning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my sides are filled with burning,
    and there is no soundness in my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am feeble and crushed;
    I groan because of the tumult of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, all my longing is before you;
    my sighing is not hidden from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart throbs; my strength fails me,
    and the light of my eyes—it also has gone from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My friends and companions stand aloof from my plague,
    and my nearest kin stand far off.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But I am like a deaf man; I do not hear,
    like a mute man who does not open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have become like a man who does not hear,
    and in whose mouth are no rebukes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But for you, O Lord, do I wait;
    it is you, O Lord my God, who will answer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I said, “Only let them not rejoice over me,
    who boast against me when my foot slips!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am ready to fall,
    and my pain is ever before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I confess my iniquity;
    I am sorry for my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But my foes are vigorous, they are mighty,
    and many are those who hate me wrongfully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who render me evil for good
    accuse me because I follow after good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not forsake me, O Lord!
    O my God, be not far from me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make haste to help me,
    O Lord, my salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “I will guard my ways,
    that I may not sin with my tongue;
I will guard my mouth with a muzzle,
    so long as the wicked are in my presence.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Behold, you have made my days a few handbreadths,
    and my lifetime is as nothing before you.
Surely all mankind stands as a mere breath! Selah
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“And now, O Lord, for what do I wait?
    My hope is in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from all my transgressions.
    Do not make me the scorn of the fool!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am mute; I do not open my mouth,
    for it is you who have done it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove your stroke from me;
    I am spent by the hostility of your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you discipline a man
    with rebukes for sin,
you consume like a moth what is dear to him;
    surely all mankind is a mere breath! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Hear my prayer, O Lord,
    and give ear to my cry;
    hold not your peace at my tears!
For I am a sojourner with you,
    a guest, like all my fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look away from me, that I may smile again,
    before I depart and am no more!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I waited patiently for the Lord;
    he inclined to me and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He drew me up from the pit of destruction,
    out of the miry bog,
and set my feet upon a rock,
    making my steps secure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He put a new song in my mouth,
    a song of praise to our God.
Many will see and fear,
    and put their trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man who makes
    the Lord his trust,
who does not turn to the proud,
    to those who go astray after a lie!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have multiplied, O Lord my God,
    your wondrous deeds and your thoughts towards us;
    none can compare with you!
I will proclaim and tell of them,
    yet they are more than can be told.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In sacrifice and offering you have not delighted,
    but you have given me an open ear.
Burnt offering and sin offering
    you have not required.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, “Behold, I have come;
    in the scroll of the book it is written of me:
speaker: Narrator

text:
I delight to do your will, O my God;
    your law is within my heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have told the glad news of deliverance
    in the great congregation;
behold, I have not restrained my lips,
    as you know, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
As for you, O Lord, you will not restrain
    your mercy from me;
your steadfast love and your faithfulness will
    ever preserve me!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me!
    O Lord, make haste to help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those be put to shame and disappointed altogether
    who seek to snatch away my life;
let those be turned back and brought to dishonour
    who delight in my hurt!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those be appalled because of their shame
    who say to me, “Aha, Aha!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But may all who seek you
    rejoice and be glad in you;
may those who love your salvation
    say continually, “Great is the Lord!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I am poor and needy,
    but the Lord takes thought for me.
You are my help and my deliverer;
    do not delay, O my God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one who considers the poor!
    In the day of trouble the Lord delivers him;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord sustains him on his sickbed;
    in his illness you restore him to full health.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I said, “O Lord, be gracious to me;
    heal me, for I have sinned against you!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies say of me in malice,
    “When will he die, and his name perish?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
All who hate me whisper together about me;
    they imagine the worst for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say, “A deadly thing is poured out on him;
    he will not rise again from where he lies.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even my close friend in whom I trusted,
    who ate my bread, has lifted his heel against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, be gracious to me,
    and raise me up, that I may repay them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
By this I know that you delight in me:
    my enemy will not shout in triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have upheld me because of my integrity,
    and set me in your presence for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting!
Amen and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a deer pants for flowing streams,
    so pants my soul for you, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul thirsts for God,
    for the living God.
When shall I come and appear before God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My tears have been my food
    day and night,
while they say to me all the day long,
    “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
These things I remember,
    as I pour out my soul:
how I would go with the throng
    and lead them in procession to the house of God
with glad shouts and songs of praise,
    a multitude keeping festival.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you cast down, O my soul,
    and why are you in turmoil within me?
Hope in God; for I shall again praise him,
    my salvation
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Deep calls to deep
    at the roar of your waterfalls;
all your breakers and your waves
    have gone over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By day the Lord commands his steadfast love,
    and at night his song is with me,
    a prayer to the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I say to God, my rock:
    “Why have you forgotten me?
Why do I go mourning
    because of the oppression of the enemy?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As with a deadly wound in my bones,
    my adversaries taunt me,
while they say to me all the day long,
    “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you cast down, O my soul,
    and why are you in turmoil within me?
Hope in God; for I shall again praise him,
    my salvation and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vindicate me, O God, and defend my cause
    against an ungodly people,
from the deceitful and unjust man
    deliver me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are the God in whom I take refuge;
    why have you rejected me?
Why do I go about mourning
    because of the oppression of the enemy?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
    to God my exceeding joy,
and I will praise you with the lyre,
    O God, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you cast down, O my soul,
    and why are you in turmoil within me?
Hope in God; for I shall again praise him,
    my salvation and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, we have heard with our ears,
    our fathers have told us,
what deeds you performed in their days,
    in the days of old:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
for not by their own sword did they win the land,
    nor did their own arm save them,
but your right hand and your arm,
    and the light of your face,
    for you delighted in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my King, O God;
    ordain salvation for Jacob!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through you we push down our foes;
    through your name we tread down those who rise up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For not in my bow do I trust,
    nor can my sword save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have saved us from our foes
    and have put to shame those who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God we have boasted continually,
    and we will give thanks to your name for ever. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have rejected us and disgraced us
    and have not gone out with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made us turn back from the foe,
    and those who hate us have taken spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made us like sheep for slaughter
    and have scattered us among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have sold your people for a trifle,
    demanding no high price for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made us the taunt of our neighbours,
    the derision and scorn of those around us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made us a byword among the nations,
    a laughing-stock among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long my disgrace is before me,
    and shame has covered my face
speaker: Narrator

text:
at the sound of the taunter and reviler,
    at the sight of the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All this has come upon us,
    though we have not forgotten you,
    and we have not been false to your covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our heart has not turned back,
    nor have our steps departed from your way;
speaker: Narrator

text:
yet you have broken us in the place of jackals
    and covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If we had forgotten the name of our God
    or spread out our hands to a foreign god,
speaker: Narrator

text:
would not God discover this?
    For he knows the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet for your sake we are killed all the day long;
    we are regarded as sheep to be slaughtered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake! Why are you sleeping, O Lord?
    Rouse yourself! Do not reject us for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you hide your face?
    Why do you forget our affliction and oppression?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our soul is bowed down to the dust;
    our belly clings to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up; come to our help!
    Redeem us for the sake of your steadfast love!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
    in your splendour and majesty!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your throne, O God, is for ever and ever.
    The sceptre of your kingdom is a sceptre of uprightness;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
your robes are all fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia.
From ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad;
speaker: Narrator

text:
daughters of kings are among your ladies of honour;
    at your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, O daughter, and consider, and incline your ear:
    forget your people and your father's house,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and the king will desire your beauty.
Since he is your lord, bow to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people of Tyre will seek your favour with gifts,
    the richest of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: All glorious is the princess in her chamber, with robes interwoven with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In many-coloured robes she is led to the king,
    with her virgin companions following behind her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With joy and gladness they are led along
    as they enter the palace of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In place of your fathers shall be your sons;
    you will make them princes in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;
    therefore nations will praise you for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is our refuge and strength,
    a very present help in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore we will not fear though the earth gives way,
    though the mountains be moved into the heart of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text:
though its waters roar and foam,
    though the mountains tremble at its swelling. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
    the holy habitation of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved;
    God will help her when morning dawns.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations rage, the kingdoms totter;
    he utters his voice, the earth melts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, behold the works of the Lord,
    how he has brought desolations on the earth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Be still, and know that I am God.
    I will be exalted among the nations,
    I will be exalted in the earth!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Clap your hands, all peoples!
    Shout to God with loud songs of joy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord, the Most High, is to be feared,
    a great king over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He subdued peoples under us,
    and nations under our feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He chose our heritage for us,
    the pride of Jacob whom he loves. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has gone up with a shout,
    the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to God, sing praises!
    Sing praises to our King, sing praises!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For God is the King of all the earth;
    sing praises with a psalm!
speaker: Narrator

text:
God reigns over the nations;
    God sits on his holy throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The princes of the peoples gather
    as the people of the God of Abraham.
For the shields of the earth belong to God;
    he is highly exalted!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised
    in the city of our God!
His holy mountain,
speaker: Narrator

text:
beautiful in elevation,
    is the joy of all the earth,
Mount Zion, in the far north,
    the city of the great King.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Within her citadels God
    has made himself known as a fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For behold, the kings assembled;
    they came on together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As soon as they saw it, they were astounded;
    they were in panic; they took to flight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trembling took hold of them there,
    anguish as of a woman in labour.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the east wind you shattered
    the ships of Tarshish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As we have heard, so have we seen
    in the city of the Lord of hosts,
in the city of our God,
    which God will establish for ever. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have thought on your steadfast love, O God,
    in the midst of your temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As your name, O God,
    so your praise reaches to the ends of the earth.
Your right hand is filled with righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Mount Zion be glad!
Let the daughters of Judah rejoice
    because of your judgements!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Walk about Zion, go round her,
    number her towers,
speaker: Narrator

text:
consider well her ramparts,
    go through her citadels,
that you may tell the next generation
speaker: Narrator

text:
that this is God,
our God for ever and ever.
    He will guide us for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, all peoples!
    Give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
speaker: Narrator

text:
both low and high,
    rich and poor together!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth shall speak wisdom;
    the meditation of my heart shall be understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will incline my ear to a proverb;
    I will solve my riddle to the music of the lyre.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should I fear in times of trouble,
    when the iniquity of those who cheat me surrounds me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
those who trust in their wealth
    and boast of the abundance of their riches?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truly no man can ransom another,
    or give to God the price of his life,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the ransom of their life is costly
    and can never suffice,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that he should live on for ever
    and never see the pit.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their graves are their homes for ever,
    their dwelling places to all generations,
    though they called lands by their own names.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man in his pomp will not remain;
    he is like the beasts that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the path of those who have foolish confidence;
    yet after them people approve of their boasts. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol;
    death shall be their shepherd,
and the upright shall rule over them in the morning.
    Their form shall be consumed in Sheol, with no place to dwell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But God will ransom my soul from the power of Sheol,
    for he will receive me. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not afraid when a man becomes rich,
    when the glory of his house increases.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For when he dies he will carry nothing away;
    his glory will not go down after him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For though, while he lives, he counts himself blessed
    —and though you get praise when you do well for yourself—
speaker: Narrator

text:
his soul will go to the generation of his fathers,
    who will never again see light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man in his pomp yet without understanding is like the beasts that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Mighty One, God the Lord,
    speaks and summons the earth
    from the rising of the sun to its setting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
    God shines forth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He calls to the heavens above
    and to the earth, that he may judge his people:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Gather to me my faithful ones,
    who made a covenant with me by sacrifice!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens declare his righteousness,
    for God himself is judge! Selah
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Not for your sacrifices do I rebuke you;
    your burnt offerings are continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not accept a bull from your house
    or goats from your folds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For every beast of the forest is mine,
    the cattle on a thousand hills.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know all the birds of the hills,
    and all that moves in the field is mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
    for the world and its fullness are mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls
    or drink the blood of goats?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
    and perform your vows to the Most High,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and call upon me in the day of trouble;
    I will deliver you, and you shall glorify me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But to the wicked God says:
    “What right have you to recite my statutes
    or take my covenant on your lips?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you hate discipline,
    and you cast my words behind you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you see a thief, you are pleased with him,
    and you keep company with adulterers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You give your mouth free rein for evil,
    and your tongue frames deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sit and speak against your brother;
    you slander your own mother's son.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Mark this, then, you who forget God,
    lest I tear you apart, and there be none to deliver!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Have mercy on me, O God,
    according to your steadfast love;
according to your abundant mercy
    blot out my transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
    and cleanse me from my sin!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I know my transgressions,
    and my sin is ever before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Against you, you only, have I sinned
    and done what is evil in your sight,
so that you may be justified in your words
    and blameless in your judgement.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity,
    and in sin did my mother conceive me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, you delight in truth in the inward being,
    and you teach me wisdom in the secret heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
    wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me hear joy and gladness;
    let the bones that you have broken rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide your face from my sins,
    and blot out all my iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Create in me a clean heart, O God,
    and renew a right spirit within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cast me not away from your presence,
    and take not your Holy Spirit from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
    and uphold me with a willing spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will teach transgressors your ways,
    and sinners will return to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God,
    O God of my salvation,
    and my tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
