O Lord, open my lips,
    and my mouth will declare your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will not delight in sacrifice, or I would give it;
    you will not be pleased with a burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit;
    a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do good to Zion in your good pleasure;
    build up the walls of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man?
    The steadfast love of God endures all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your tongue plots destruction,
    like a sharp razor, you worker of deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You love evil more than good,
    and lying more than speaking what is right. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
You love all words that devour,
    O deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The righteous shall see and fear,
    and shall laugh at him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“See the man who would not make
    God his refuge,
but trusted in the abundance of his riches
    and sought refuge in his own destruction!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am like a green olive tree
    in the house of God.
I trust in the steadfast love of God
    for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will thank you for ever,
    because you have done it.
I will wait for your name, for it is good,
    in the presence of the godly.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
God looks down from heaven
    on the children of man
to see if there are any who understand,
    who seek after God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Have those who work evil no knowledge,
    who eat up my people as they eat bread,
    and do not call upon God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
There they are, in great terror,
    where there is no terror!
For God scatters the bones of him who encamps against you;
    you put them to shame, for God has rejected them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion!
    When God restores the fortunes of his people,
    let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, save me by your name,
    and vindicate me by your might.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, hear my prayer;
    give ear to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Behold, God is my helper;
    the Lord is the upholder of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will return the evil to my enemies;
    in your faithfulness put an end to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to you;
    I will give thanks to your name, O Lord, for it is good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has delivered me from every trouble,
    and my eye has looked in triumph on my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give ear to my prayer, O God,
    and hide not yourself from my plea for mercy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Attend to me, and answer me;
    I am restless in my complaint and I moan,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because of the noise of the enemy,
    because of the oppression of the wicked.
For they drop trouble upon me,
    and in anger they bear a grudge against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is in anguish within me;
    the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fear and trembling come upon me,
    and horror overwhelms me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I say, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove!
    I would fly away and be at rest;
speaker: Narrator

text:
yes, I would wander far away;
    I would lodge in the wilderness; Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
I would hurry to find a shelter
    from the raging wind and tempest.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Destroy, O Lord, divide their tongues;
    for I see violence and strife in the city.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For it is not an enemy who taunts me—
    then I could bear it;
it is not an adversary who deals insolently with me—
    then I could hide from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But it is you, a man, my equal,
    my companion, my familiar friend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We used to take sweet counsel together;
    within God's house we walked in the throng.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But I call to God,
    and the Lord will save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evening and morning and at noon
    I utter my complaint and moan,
    and he hears my voice.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
God will give ear and humble them,
    he who is enthroned from of old, Selah
because they do not change
    and do not fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My companion stretched out his hand against his friends;
    he violated his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His speech was smooth as butter,
    yet war was in his heart;
his words were softer than oil,
    yet they were drawn swords.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cast your burden on the Lord,
    and he will sustain you;
he will never permit
    the righteous to be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O God, will cast them down
    into the pit of destruction;
men of blood and treachery
    shall not live out half their days.
But I will trust in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be gracious to me, O God, for man tramples on me;
    all day long an attacker oppresses me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
my enemies trample on me all day long,
    for many attack me proudly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I am afraid,
    I put my trust in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God, whose word I praise,
    in God I trust; I shall not be afraid.
    What can flesh do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long they injure my cause;
    all their thoughts are against me for evil.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For their crime will they escape?
    In wrath cast down the peoples, O God!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then my enemies will turn back
    in the day when I call.
    This I know, that God is for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God, whose word I praise,
    in the Lord, whose word I praise,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in God I trust; I shall not be afraid.
    What can man do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I must perform my vows to you, O God;
    I will render thank offerings to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have delivered my soul from death,
    yes, my feet from falling,
that I may walk before God
    in the light of life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me,
    for in you my soul takes refuge;
in the shadow of your wings I will take refuge,
    till the storms of destruction pass by.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry out to God Most High,
    to God who fulfils his purpose for me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My soul is in the midst of lions;
    I lie down amid fiery beasts—
the children of man, whose teeth are spears and arrows,
    whose tongues are sharp swords.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens!
    Let your glory be over all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They set a net for my steps;
    my soul was bowed down.
They dug a pit in my way,
    but they have fallen into it themselves. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is steadfast, O God,
    my heart is steadfast!
I will sing and make melody!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, my glory!
Awake, O harp and lyre!
    I will awake the dawn!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you, O Lord, among the peoples;
    I will sing praises to you among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your steadfast love is great to the heavens,
    your faithfulness to the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens!
    Let your glory be over all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do you indeed decree what is right, you gods?
    Do you judge the children of man uprightly?
speaker: Narrator

text:
No, in your hearts you devise wrongs;
    your hands deal out violence on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are estranged from the womb;
    they go astray from birth, speaking lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have venom like the venom of a serpent,
    like the deaf adder that stops its ear,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that it does not hear the voice of charmers
    or of the cunning enchanter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, break the teeth in their mouths;
    tear out the fangs of the young lions, O Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them vanish like water that runs away;
    when he aims his arrows, let them be blunted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be like the snail that dissolves into slime,
    like the stillborn child who never sees the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sooner than your pots can feel the heat of thorns,
    whether green or ablaze, may he sweep them away!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance;
    he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mankind will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous;
    surely there is a God who judges on earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God;
    protect me from those who rise up against me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
deliver me from those who work evil,
    and save me from bloodthirsty men.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
for no fault of mine, they run and make ready.
Awake, come to meet me, and see!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Each evening they come back,
    howling like dogs
    and prowling about the city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There they are, bellowing with their mouths
    with swords in their lips—
    for “Who,” they think, “will hear us?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, O Lord, laugh at them;
    you hold all the nations in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O my Strength, I will watch for you,
    for you, O God, are my fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God in his steadfast love will meet me;
    God will let me look in triumph on my enemies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the sin of their mouths, the words of their lips,
    let them be trapped in their pride.
For the cursing and lies that they utter,
speaker: Narrator

text:
consume them in wrath;
    consume them till they are no more,
that they may know that God rules over Jacob
    to the ends of the earth. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Each evening they come back,
    howling like dogs
    and prowling about the city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They wander about for food
    and growl if they do not get their fill.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will sing of your strength;
    I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning.
For you have been to me a fortress
    and a refuge in the day of my distress.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O God, you have rejected us, broken our defences;
    you have been angry; oh, restore us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made the land to quake; you have torn it open;
    repair its breaches, for it totters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made your people see hard things;
    you have given us wine to drink that made us stagger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have set up a banner for those who fear you,
    that they may flee to it from the bow. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
That your beloved ones may be delivered,
    give salvation by your right hand and answer us!
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has spoken in his holiness:
    “With exultation I will divide up Shechem
    and portion out the Vale of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you not rejected us, O God?
    You do not go forth, O God, with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, grant us help against the foe,
    for vain is the salvation of man!
speaker: Narrator

text:
With God we shall do valiantly;
    it is he who will tread down our foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my cry, O God,
    listen to my prayer;
speaker: Narrator

text:
from the end of the earth I call to you
    when my heart is faint.
Lead me to the rock
    that is higher than I,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for you have been my refuge,
    a strong tower against the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me dwell in your tent for ever!
    Let me take refuge under the shelter of your wings! Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, O God, have heard my vows;
    you have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Prolong the life of the king;
    may his years endure to all generations!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he be enthroned for ever before God;
    appoint steadfast love and faithfulness to watch over him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
So will I ever sing praises to your name,
    as I perform my vows day after day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For God alone my soul waits in silence;
    from him comes my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He only is my rock and my salvation,
    my fortress; I shall not be greatly shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long will all of you attack a man
    to batter him,
    like a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They only plan to thrust him down from his high position.
    They take pleasure in falsehood.
They bless with their mouths,
    but inwardly they curse. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
For God alone, O my soul, wait in silence,
    for my hope is from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He only is my rock and my salvation,
    my fortress; I shall not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On God rests my salvation and my glory;
    my mighty rock, my refuge is God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
and that to you, O Lord, belongs steadfast love.
For you will render to a man
    according to his work.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
So I have looked upon you in the sanctuary,
    beholding your power and glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because your steadfast love is better than life,
    my lips will praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will bless you as long as I live;
    in your name I will lift up my hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul will be satisfied as with fat and rich food,
    and my mouth will praise you with joyful lips,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when I remember you upon my bed,
    and meditate on you in the watches of the night;
speaker: Narrator

text:
for you have been my help,
    and in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul clings to you;
    your right hand upholds me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But those who seek to destroy my life
    shall go down into the depths of the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they shall be given over to the power of the sword;
    they shall be a portion for jackals.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint;
    preserve my life from dread of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide me from the secret plots of the wicked,
    from the throng of evildoers,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who whet their tongues like swords,
    who aim bitter words like arrows,
speaker: Narrator

text:
shooting from ambush at the blameless,
    shooting at him suddenly and without fear.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They search out injustice,
saying, “We have accomplished a diligent search.”
    For the inward mind and heart of a man are deep!
speaker: Narrator

text:
But God shoots his arrow at them;
    they are wounded suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are brought to ruin, with their own tongues turned against them;
    all who see them will wag their heads.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let the righteous one rejoice in the Lord
    and take refuge in him!
Let all the upright in heart exult!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise is due to you, O God, in Zion,
    and to you shall vows be performed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O you who hear prayer,
    to you shall all flesh come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When iniquities prevail against me,
    you atone for our transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one you choose and bring near,
    to dwell in your courts!
We shall be satisfied with the goodness of your house,
    the holiness of your temple!
speaker: Narrator

text:
By awesome deeds you answer us with righteousness,
    O God of our salvation,
the hope of all the ends of the earth
    and of the farthest seas;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the one who by his strength established the mountains,
    being girded with might;
speaker: Narrator

text:
who stills the roaring of the seas,
    the roaring of their waves,
    the tumult of the peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that those who dwell at the ends of the earth are in awe at your signs.
You make the going out of the morning and the evening to shout for joy.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You water its furrows abundantly,
    settling its ridges,
softening it with showers,
    and blessing its growth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You crown the year with your bounty;
    your wagon tracks overflow with abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The pastures of the wilderness overflow,
    the hills gird themselves with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the meadows clothe themselves with flocks,
    the valleys deck themselves with corn,
    they shout and sing together for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shout for joy to God, all the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text:
sing the glory of his name;
    give to him glorious praise!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say to God, “How awesome are your deeds!
    So great is your power that your enemies come cringing to you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Come and see what God has done:
    he is awesome in his deeds towards the children of man.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
who rules by his might for ever,
whose eyes keep watch on the nations—
    let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless our God, O peoples;
    let the sound of his praise be heard,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who has kept our soul among the living
    and has not let our feet slip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, O God, have tested us;
    you have tried us as silver is tried.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You brought us into the net;
    you laid a crushing burden on our backs;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will come into your house with burnt offerings;
    I will perform my vows to you,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that which my lips uttered

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Come and hear, all you who fear God,

speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried to him with my mouth,

speaker: Narrator

text:
If I had cherished iniquity in my heart,
    the Lord would not have listened.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But truly God has listened;
    he has attended to the voice of my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be God,

speaker: Narrator

text:
May God be gracious to us and bless us

speaker: Narrator

text:
that your way may be known on earth,
    your saving power among all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
    let all the peoples praise you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
    let all the peoples praise you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth has yielded its increase;
    God, our God, shall bless us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God shall bless us;
    let all the ends of the earth fear him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
God shall arise, his enemies shall be scattered;

speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Father of the fatherless and protector of widows

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O God, when you went out before your people,

speaker: Narrator

text:
the earth quaked, the heavens poured down rain,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
your flock found a dwelling in it;

speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord gives the word;

speaker: Narrator

text:
“The kings of the armies—they flee, they flee!”

speaker: Narrator

text:
though you men lie among the sheepfolds—
the wings of a dove covered with silver,

speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Almighty scatters kings there,

speaker: Narrator

text:
O mountain of God, mountain of Bashan;

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You ascended on high,

even among the rebellious, that the Lord God may dwell there.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Our God is a God of salvation,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord said,

I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Your procession is seen, O God,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Save me, O God!
    For the waters have come up to my neck.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I sink in deep mire,
    where there is no foothold;
I have come into deep waters,
    and the flood sweeps over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am weary with my crying out;
    my throat is parched.
My eyes grow dim
    with waiting for my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
More in number than the hairs of my head
    are those who hate me without cause;
mighty are those who would destroy me,
    those who attack me with lies.
What I did not steal
    must I now restore?
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, you know my folly;
    the wrongs I have done are not hidden from you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For it is for your sake that I have borne reproach,
    that dishonour has covered my face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have become a stranger to my brothers,
    an alien to my mother's sons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For zeal for your house has consumed me,
    and the reproaches of those who reproach you have fallen on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I wept and humbled my soul with fasting,

speaker: Narrator

text:
When I made sackcloth my clothing,

speaker: Narrator

text:
I am the talk of those who sit in the gate,

speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Lord.
    At an acceptable time, O God,
    in the abundance of your steadfast love answer me in your saving faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me
    from sinking in the mire;
let me be delivered from my enemies

speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not the flood sweep over me,
    or the deep swallow me up,
    or the pit close its mouth over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Answer me, O Lord, for your steadfast love is good;
    according to your abundant mercy, turn to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide not your face from your servant;
    for I am in distress; make haste to answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Draw near to my soul, redeem me;
    ransom me because of my enemies!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Reproaches have broken my heart,
    so that I am in despair.
I looked for pity, but there was none,
    and for comforters, but I found none.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They gave me poison for food,
    and for my thirst they gave me sour wine to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their own table before them become a snare;

speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Pour out your indignation upon them,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
For they persecute him whom you have struck down,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living;

speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am afflicted and in pain;

speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise the name of God with a song;

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
the offspring of his servants shall inherit it,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

Narrator

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness, O God,

text:

text:

text:

Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, are ended.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truly God is good to Israel,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
For I was envious of the arrogant

speaker: Narrator

text:
For they have no pangs until death;
    their bodies are fat and sleek.
speaker: Narrator

text:

    they are not stricken like the rest of mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore pride is their necklace;
    violence covers them as a garment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their eyes swell out through fatness;
    their hearts overflow with follies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They scoff and speak with malice;
    loftily they threaten oppression.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They set their mouths against the heavens,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore his people turn back to them,
    and find no fault in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they say, “How can God know?
    Is there knowledge in the Most High?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, these are the wicked;

speaker: Narrator

text:
All in vain have I kept my heart clean

speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the day long I have been stricken

speaker: Narrator

text:
If I had said, “I will speak thus”,

speaker: Narrator

text:
But when I thought how to understand this,
    it seemed to me a wearisome task,
speaker: Narrator

text:
until I went into the sanctuary of God;

speaker: Narrator

text:
Truly you set them in slippery places;
    you make them fall to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How they are destroyed in a moment,
    swept away utterly by terrors!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a dream when one awakes,
    O Lord, when you rouse yourself, you despise them as phantoms.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When my soul was embittered,
    when I was pricked in heart,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was brutish and ignorant;
    I was like a beast towards you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nevertheless, I am continually with you;
    you hold my right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You guide me with your counsel,
    and afterwards you will receive me to glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whom have I in heaven but you?

speaker: Narrator

text:
My flesh and my heart may fail,
    but God is the strength of my heart and my portion for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For behold, those who are far from you shall perish;

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O God, why do you cast us off for ever?

speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember your congregation, which you have purchased of old,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Direct your steps to the perpetual ruins;
    the enemy has destroyed everything in the sanctuary!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your foes have roared in the midst of your meeting place;

speaker: Narrator

text:
They were like those who swing axes
    in a forest of trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And all its carved wood

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They said to themselves, “We will utterly subdue them”;

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
How long, O God, is the foe to scoff?
    Is the enemy to revile your name for ever?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand?

speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet God my King is from of old,
    working salvation in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You divided the sea by your might;
    you broke the heads of the sea monsters on the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:

    you gave him as food for the creatures of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text:

    you dried up ever-flowing streams.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yours is the day, yours also the night;

speaker: Narrator

text:
You have fixed all the boundaries of the earth;
    you have made summer and winter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember this, O Lord, how the enemy scoffs,

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not the downtrodden turn back in shame;
    let the poor and needy praise your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O God, defend your cause;
    remember how the foolish scoff at you all the day!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not forget the clamour of your foes,
    the uproar of those who rise against you, which goes up continually!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“At the set time that I appoint
    I will judge with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the earth totters, and all its inhabitants,

speaker: Narrator

text:
I say to the boastful, ‘Do not boast’,

speaker: Narrator

text:
do not lift up your horn on high,
    or speak with haughty neck.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For not from the east or from the west

text:

text:
For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup

text:
But I will declare it for ever;

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
There he broke the flashing arrows,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Glorious are you, more majestic

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, you are to be feared!

speaker: Narrator

text:

    the earth feared and was still,
speaker: Narrator

text:

    to save all the humble of the earth. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely the wrath of man shall praise you;

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
who cuts off the spirit of princes,

speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry aloud to God,
    aloud to God, and he will hear me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When I remember God, I moan;
    when I meditate, my spirit faints. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hold my eyelids open;
    I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I consider the days of old,
    the years long ago.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Will the Lord spurn for ever,
    and never again be favourable?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Has his steadfast love for ever ceased?
    Are his promises at an end for all time?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Has God forgotten to be gracious?
    Has he in anger shut up his compassion?” Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, “I will appeal to this,
    to the years of the right hand of the Most High.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will remember the deeds of the Lord;
    yes, I will remember your wonders of old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will ponder all your work,
    and meditate on your mighty deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your way, O God, is holy.
    What god is great like our God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the God who works wonders;
    you have made known your might among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You with your arm redeemed your people,
    the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
You led your people like a flock
    by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give ear, O my people, to my teaching;
    incline your ears to the words of my mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will open my mouth in a parable;
    I will utter dark sayings from of old,
speaker: Narrator

text:
things that we have heard and known,
    that our fathers have told us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We will not hide them from their children,
    but tell to the coming generation
the glorious deeds of the Lord, and his might,
    and the wonders that he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He established a testimony in Jacob
    and appointed a law in Israel,
which he commanded our fathers
    to teach to their children,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that the next generation might know them,
    the children yet unborn,

text:
There go the ships,
    and Leviathan, which you formed to play in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These all look to you,
    to give them their food in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you give it to them, they gather it up;
    when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When you send forth your Spirit, they are created,
    and you renew the face of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the glory of the Lord endure for ever;
    may the Lord rejoice in his works,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who looks on the earth and it trembles,
    who touches the mountains and they smoke!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
    I will sing praise to my God while I have being.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my meditation be pleasing to him,
    for I rejoice in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let sinners be consumed from the earth,
    and let the wicked be no more!
Bless the Lord, O my soul!
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the Lord; call upon his name;
    make known his deeds among the peoples!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him, sing praises to him;
    tell of all his wondrous works!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glory in his holy name;
    let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and his strength;
    seek his presence continually!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember the wondrous works that he has done,
    his miracles, and the judgements he uttered,
speaker: Narrator

text:
O offspring of Abraham, his servant,
    children of Jacob, his chosen ones!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God;
    his judgements are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembers his covenant for ever,
    the word that he commanded, for a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the covenant that he made with Abraham,
    his sworn promise to Isaac,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which he confirmed to Jacob as a statute,
    to Israel as an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
    as your portion for an inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they were few in number,
    of little account, and sojourners in it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wandering from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he allowed no one to oppress them;
    he rebuked kings on their account,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “Touch not my anointed ones,
    do my prophets no harm!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he summoned a famine on the land
    and broke all supply of bread,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he had sent a man ahead of them,
    Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His feet were hurt with fetters;
    his neck was put in a collar of iron;
speaker: Narrator

text:
until what he had said came to pass,
    the word of the Lord tested him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king sent and released him;
    the ruler of the peoples set him free;
speaker: Narrator

text:
he made him lord of his house
    and ruler of all his possessions,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to bind his princes at his pleasure
    and to teach his elders wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Israel came to Egypt;
    Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Lord made his people very fruitful
    and made them stronger than their foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their hearts to hate his people,
    to deal craftily with his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent Moses, his servant,
    and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They performed his signs among them
    and miracles in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent darkness, and made the land dark;
    they did not rebel against his words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their waters into blood
    and caused their fish to die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their land swarmed with frogs,
    even in the chambers of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and there came swarms of flies,
    and gnats throughout their country.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them hail for rain,
    and fiery lightning bolts through their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck down their vines and fig trees,
    and shattered the trees of their country.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and the locusts came,
    young locusts without number,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which devoured all the vegetation in their land
    and ate up the fruit of their ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck down all the firstborn in their land,
    the firstfruits of all their strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he brought out Israel with silver and gold,
    and there was none among his tribes who stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt was glad when they departed,
    for dread of them had fallen upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spread a cloud for a covering,
    and fire to give light by night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked, and he brought quail,
    and gave them bread from heaven in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He opened the rock, and water gushed out;
    it flowed through the desert like a river.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he remembered his holy promise,
    and Abraham, his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he brought his people out with joy,
    his chosen ones with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he gave them the lands of the nations,
    and they took possession of the fruit of the peoples' toil,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that they might keep his statutes
    and observe his laws.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
    for his steadfast love endures for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can utter the mighty deeds of the Lord,
    or declare all his praise?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are they who observe justice,
    who do righteousness at all times!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember me, O Lord, when you show favour to your people;
    help me when you save them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I may look upon the prosperity of your chosen ones,
    that I may rejoice in the gladness of your nation,
    that I may glory with your inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Both we and our fathers have sinned;
    we have committed iniquity; we have done wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our fathers, when they were in Egypt,
    did not consider your wondrous works;
they did not remember the abundance of your steadfast love,
    but rebelled by the sea, at the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet he saved them for his name's sake,
    that he might make known his mighty power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rebuked the Red Sea, and it became dry,
    and he led them through the deep as through a desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he saved them from the hand of the foe
    and redeemed them from the power of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the waters covered their adversaries;
    not one of them was left.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they believed his words;
    they sang his praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they soon forgot his works;
    they did not wait for his counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they had a wanton craving in the wilderness,
    and put God to the test in the desert;
speaker: Narrator

text:
he gave them what they asked,
    but sent a wasting disease among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When men in the camp were jealous of Moses
    and Aaron, the holy one of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
    and covered the company of Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire also broke out in their company;
    the flame burned up the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made a calf in Horeb
    and worshipped a metal image.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They exchanged the glory of God
    for the image of an ox that eats grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They forgot God, their Saviour,
    who had done great things in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wondrous works in the land of Ham,
    and awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he said he would destroy them—
    had not Moses, his chosen one,
stood in the breach before him,
    to turn away his wrath from destroying them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they despised the pleasant land,
    having no faith in his promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They murmured in their tents,
    and did not obey the voice of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he raised his hand and swore to them
    that he would make them fall in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and would make their offspring fall among the nations,
    scattering them among the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor,
    and ate sacrifices offered to the dead;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they provoked the Lord to anger with their deeds,
    and a plague broke out among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Phinehas stood up and intervened,
    and the plague was stayed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And that was counted to him as righteousness
    from generation to generation for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They angered him at the waters of Meribah,
    and it went ill with Moses on their account,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for they made his spirit bitter,
    and he spoke rashly with his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They did not destroy the peoples,
    as the Lord commanded them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but they mixed with the nations
    and learned to do as they did.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They served their idols,
    which became a snare to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They sacrificed their sons
    and their daughters to the demons;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they poured out innocent blood,
    the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
    and the land was polluted with blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they became unclean by their acts,
    and played the whore in their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the anger of the Lord was kindled against his people,
    and he abhorred his heritage;
speaker: Narrator

text:
he gave them into the hand of the nations,
    so that those who hated them ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their enemies oppressed them,
    and they were brought into subjection under their power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many times he delivered them,
    but they were rebellious in their purposes
    and were brought low through their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nevertheless, he looked upon their distress,
    when he heard their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their sake he remembered his covenant,
    and relented according to the abundance of his steadfast love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He caused them to be pitied
    by all those who held them captive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save us, O Lord our God,
    and gather us from among the nations,
that we may give thanks to your holy name
    and glory in your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting!
And let all the people say, “Amen!”
    Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
    for his steadfast love endures for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the redeemed of the Lord say so,
    whom he has redeemed from trouble
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Some wandered in desert wastes,
    finding no way to a city to dwell in;
speaker: Narrator

text:
hungry and thirsty,
    their soul fainted within them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he delivered them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led them by a straight way
    till they reached a city to dwell in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wondrous works to the children of man!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he satisfies the longing soul,
    and the hungry soul he fills with good things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,
    prisoners in affliction and in irons,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for they had rebelled against the words of God,
    and spurned the counsel of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he bowed their hearts down with hard labour;
    they fell down, with none to help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he delivered them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,
    and burst their bonds apart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wondrous works to the children of man!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he shatters the doors of bronze
    and cuts in two the bars of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some were fools through their sinful ways,
    and because of their iniquities suffered affliction;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they loathed any kind of food,
    and they drew near to the gates of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he delivered them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent out his word and healed them,
    and delivered them from their destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wondrous works to the children of man!
speaker: Narrator

text:
And let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving,
    and tell of his deeds in songs of joy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some went down to the sea in ships,
    doing business on the great waters;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they saw the deeds of the Lord,
    his wondrous works in the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he commanded and raised the stormy wind,
    which lifted up the waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They mounted up to heaven; they went down to the depths;
    their courage melted away in their evil plight;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they reeled and staggered like drunken men
    and were at their wits' end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he delivered them from their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made the storm be still,
    and the waves of the sea were hushed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they were glad that the waters were quiet,
    and he brought them to their desired haven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them thank the Lord for his steadfast love,
    for his wondrous works to the children of man!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them extol him in the congregation of the people,
    and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turns rivers into a desert,
    springs of water into thirsty ground,
speaker: Narrator

text:
a fruitful land into a salty waste,
    because of the evil of its inhabitants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turns a desert into pools of water,
    a parched land into springs of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And there he lets the hungry dwell,
    and they establish a city to live in;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they sow fields and plant vineyards
    and get a fruitful yield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By his blessing they multiply greatly,
    and he does not let their livestock diminish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they are diminished and brought low
    through oppression, evil, and sorrow,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he pours contempt on princes
    and makes them wander in trackless wastes;
speaker: Narrator

text:
but he raises up the needy out of affliction
    and makes their families like flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The upright see it and are glad,
    and all wickedness shuts its mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoever is wise, let him attend to these things;
    let them consider the steadfast love of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is steadfast, O God!
    I will sing and make melody with all my being!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, O harp and lyre!
    I will awake the dawn!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you, O Lord, among the peoples;
    I will sing praises to you among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your steadfast love is great above the heavens;
    your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens!
    Let your glory be over all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
That your beloved ones may be delivered,
    give salvation by your right hand and answer me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has promised in his holiness:
    “With exultation I will divide up Shechem
    and portion out the Valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you not rejected us, O God?
    You do not go out, O God, with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh grant us help against the foe,
    for vain is the salvation of man!
speaker: Narrator

text:
With God we shall do valiantly;
    it is he who will tread down our foes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not silent, O God of my praise!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For wicked and deceitful mouths are opened against me,
    speaking against me with lying tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They encircle me with words of hate,
    and attack me without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In return for my love they accuse me,
    but I give myself to prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they reward me evil for good,
    and hatred for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Appoint a wicked man against him;
    let an accuser stand at his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he is tried, let him come forth guilty;
    let his prayer be counted as sin!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his days be few;
    may another take his office!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his children be fatherless
    and his wife a widow!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his children wander about and beg,
    seeking food far from the ruins they inhabit!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the creditor seize all that he has;
    may strangers plunder the fruits of his toil!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let there be none to extend kindness to him,
    nor any to pity his fatherless children!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May his posterity be cut off;
    may his name be blotted out in the second generation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord,
    and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be before the Lord continually,
    that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he did not remember to show kindness,
    but pursued the poor and needy
    and the broken-hearted, to put them to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He loved to curse; let curses come upon him!
    He did not delight in blessing; may it be far from him!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
May it be like a garment that he wraps round him,
    like a belt that he puts on every day!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May this be the reward of my accusers from the Lord,
    of those who speak evil against my life!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For I am poor and needy,
    and my heart is stricken within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am gone like a shadow at evening;
    I am shaken off like a locust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My knees are weak through fasting;
    my body has become gaunt, with no fat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am an object of scorn to my accusers;
    when they see me, they wag their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me, O Lord my God!
    Save me according to your steadfast love!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them know that this is your hand;
    you, O Lord, have done it!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them curse, but you will bless!
    They arise and are put to shame, but your servant will be glad!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my accusers be clothed with dishonour;
    may they be wrapped in their own shame as in a cloak!
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my mouth I will give great thanks to the Lord;
    I will praise him in the midst of the throng.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he stands at the right hand of the needy one,
    to save him from those who condemn his soul to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord says to my Lord:
    “Sit at my right hand,
until I make your enemies your footstool.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord sends forth from Zion
    your mighty sceptre.
    Rule in the midst of your enemies!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord has sworn
    and will not change his mind,
“You are a priest for ever
    after the order of Melchizedek.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is at your right hand;
    he will shatter kings on the day of his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will execute judgement among the nations,
    filling them with corpses;
he will shatter chiefs
    over the wide earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will drink from the brook by the way;
    therefore he will lift up his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart,
    in the company of the upright, in the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great are the works of the Lord,
    studied by all who delight in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Full of splendour and majesty is his work,
    and his righteousness endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has caused his wondrous works to be remembered;
    the Lord is gracious and merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He provides food for those who fear him;
    he remembers his covenant for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has shown his people the power of his works,
    in giving them the inheritance of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The works of his hands are faithful and just;
    all his precepts are trustworthy;
speaker: Narrator

text:
they are established for ever and ever,
    to be performed with faithfulness and uprightness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Blessed is the man who fears the Lord,
    who greatly delights in his commandments!
speaker: Narrator

text:
His offspring will be mighty in the land;
    the generation of the upright will be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wealth and riches are in his house,
    and his righteousness endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Light dawns in the darkness for the upright;
    he is gracious, merciful, and righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is well with the man who deals generously and lends;
    who conducts his affairs with justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the righteous will never be moved;
    he will be remembered for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is not afraid of bad news;
    his heart is firm, trusting in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His heart is steady; he will not be afraid,
    until he looks in triumph on his adversaries.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Praise, O servants of the Lord,
    praise the name of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the name of the Lord
    from this time forth and for evermore!
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the rising of the sun to its setting,
    the name of the Lord is to be praised!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is high above all nations,
    and his glory above the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is like the Lord our God,
    who is seated on high,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who looks far down
    on the heavens and the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He raises the poor from the dust
    and lifts the needy from the ash heap,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to make them sit with princes,
    with the princes of his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives the barren woman a home,
    making her the joyous mother of children.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Israel went out from Egypt,
    the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judah became his sanctuary,
    Israel his dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea looked and fled;
    Jordan turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
    the hills like lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What ails you, O sea, that you flee?
    O Jordan, that you turn back?
speaker: Narrator

text:
O mountains, that you skip like rams?
    O hills, like lambs?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
    at the presence of the God of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who turns the rock into a pool of water,
    the flint into a spring of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Not to us, O Lord, not to us, but to your name give glory,
    for the sake of your steadfast love and your faithfulness!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where is their God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our God is in the heavens;
    he does all that he pleases.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their idols are silver and gold,
    the work of human hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but do not speak;
    eyes, but do not see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears, but do not hear;
    noses, but do not smell.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Those who make them become like them;
    so do all who trust in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, trust in the Lord!
    He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord!
    He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord!
    He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
he will bless those who fear the Lord,
    both the small and the great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord give you increase,
    you and your children!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May you be blessed by the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens are the Lord's heavens,
    but the earth he has given to the children of man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
    nor do any who go down into silence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But we will bless the Lord
    from this time forth and for evermore.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love the Lord, because he has heard
    my voice and my pleas for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because he inclined his ear to me,
    therefore I will call on him as long as I live.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then I called on the name of the Lord:
    “O Lord, I pray, deliver my soul!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gracious is the Lord, and righteous;
    our God is merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord preserves the simple;
    when I was brought low, he saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, O my soul, to your rest;
    for the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will walk before the Lord
    in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I believed, even when I spoke,
    “I am greatly afflicted”;
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said in my alarm,
    “All mankind are liars.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
What shall I render to the Lord
    for all his benefits to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lift up the cup of salvation
    and call on the name of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will pay my vows to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Precious in the sight of the Lord
    is the death of his saints.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving
    and call on the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will pay my vows to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in the courts of the house of the Lord,
    in your midst, O Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all nations!
    Extol him, all peoples!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For great is his steadfast love towards us,
    and the faithfulness of the Lord endures for ever.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;
    for his steadfast love endures for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Israel say,
    “His steadfast love endures for ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the house of Aaron say,
    “His steadfast love endures for ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who fear the Lord say,
    “His steadfast love endures for ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of my distress I called on the Lord;
    the Lord answered me and set me free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is on my side; I will not fear.
    What can man do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is on my side as my helper;
    I shall look in triumph on those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All nations surrounded me;
    in the name of the Lord I cut them off!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surrounded me, surrounded me on every side;
    in the name of the Lord I cut them off!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I was pushed hard, so that I was falling,
    but the Lord helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my strength and my song;
    he has become my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glad songs of salvation
    are in the tents of the righteous:
“The right hand of the Lord does valiantly,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the right hand of the Lord exalts,
    the right hand of the Lord does valiantly!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall not die, but I shall live,
    and recount the deeds of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has disciplined me severely,
    but he has not given me over to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open to me the gates of righteousness,
    that I may enter through them
    and give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the gate of the Lord;
    the righteous shall enter through it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I thank you that you have answered me
    and have become my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the Lord's doing;
    it is marvellous in our eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the day that the Lord has made;
    let us rejoice and be glad in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save us, we pray, O Lord!
    O Lord, we pray, give us success!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!
    We bless you from the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is God,
    and he has made his light to shine upon us.
Bind the festal sacrifice with cords,
    up to the horns of the altar!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my God, and I will give thanks to you;
    you are my God; I will extol you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;
    for his steadfast love endures for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those whose way is blameless,
    who walk in the law of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who keep his testimonies,
    who seek him with their whole heart,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who also do no wrong,
    but walk in his ways!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have commanded your precepts
    to be kept diligently.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that my ways may be steadfast
    in keeping your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I shall not be put to shame,
    having my eyes fixed on all your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise you with an upright heart,
    when I learn your righteous rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will keep your statutes;
    do not utterly forsake me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can a young man keep his way pure?
    By guarding it according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my whole heart I seek you;
    let me not wander from your commandments!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have stored up your word in my heart,
    that I might not sin against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are you, O Lord;
    teach me your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my lips I declare
    all the rules of your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the way of your testimonies I delight
    as much as in all riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will meditate on your precepts
    and fix my eyes on your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will delight in your statutes;
    I will not forget your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deal bountifully with your servant,
    that I may live and keep your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open my eyes, that I may behold
    wondrous things out of your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a sojourner on the earth;
    hide not your commandments from me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is consumed with longing
    for your rules at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rebuke the insolent, accursed ones,
    who wander from your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away from me scorn and contempt,
    for I have kept your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though princes sit plotting against me,
    your servant will meditate on your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are my delight;
    they are my counsellors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul clings to the dust;
    give me life according to your word!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I told of my ways, you answered me;
    teach me your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make me understand the way of your precepts,
    and I will meditate on your wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul melts away for sorrow;
    strengthen me according to your word!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put false ways far from me
    and graciously teach me your law!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have chosen the way of faithfulness;
    I set your rules before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cling to your testimonies, O Lord;
    let me not be put to shame!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will run in the way of your commandments
    when you enlarge my heart!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me, O Lord, the way of your statutes;
    and I will keep it to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me understanding, that I may keep your law
    and observe it with my whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lead me in the path of your commandments,
    for I delight in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Incline my heart to your testimonies,
    and not to selfish gain!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn my eyes from looking at worthless things;
    and give me life in your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Confirm to your servant your promise,
    that you may be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away the reproach that I dread,
    for your rules are good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I long for your precepts;
    in your righteousness give me life!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your steadfast love come to me, O Lord,
    your salvation according to your promise;
speaker: Narrator

text:
then shall I have an answer for him who taunts me,
    for I trust in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth,
    for my hope is in your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will keep your law continually,
    for ever and ever,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and I shall walk in a wide place,
    for I have sought your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also speak of your testimonies before kings
    and shall not be put to shame,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for I find my delight in your commandments,
    which I love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lift up my hands towards your commandments, which I love,
    and I will meditate on your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember your word to your servant,
    in which you have made me hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is my comfort in my affliction,
    that your promise gives me life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The insolent utterly deride me,
    but I do not turn away from your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I think of your rules from of old,
    I take comfort, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hot indignation seizes me because of the wicked,
    who forsake your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your statutes have been my songs
    in the house of my sojourning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember your name in the night, O Lord,
    and keep your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This blessing has fallen to me,
    that I have kept your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my portion;
    I promise to keep your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I entreat your favour with all my heart;
    be gracious to me according to your promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I think on my ways,
    I turn my feet to your testimonies;
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hasten and do not delay
    to keep your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though the cords of the wicked ensnare me,
    I do not forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At midnight I rise to praise you,
    because of your righteous rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a companion of all who fear you,
    of those who keep your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth, O Lord, is full of your steadfast love;
    teach me your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have dealt well with your servant,
    O Lord, according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me good judgement and knowledge,
    for I believe in your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before I was afflicted I went astray,
    but now I keep your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are good and do good;
    teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The insolent smear me with lies,
    but with my whole heart I keep your precepts;
speaker: Narrator

text:
their heart is unfeeling like fat,
    but I delight in your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is good for me that I was afflicted,
    that I might learn your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The law of your mouth is better to me
    than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hands have made and fashioned me;
    give me understanding that I may learn your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who fear you shall see me and rejoice,
    because I have hoped in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know, O Lord, that your rules are righteous,
    and that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your steadfast love comfort me
    according to your promise to your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your mercy come to me, that I may live;
    for your law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let those who fear you turn to me,
    that they may know your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my heart be blameless in your statutes,
    that I may not be put to shame!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul longs for your salvation;
    I hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes long for your promise;
    I ask, “When will you comfort me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
    yet I have not forgotten your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long must your servant endure?
    When will you judge those who persecute me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The insolent have dug pitfalls for me;
    they do not live according to your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your commandments are sure;
    they persecute me with falsehood; help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have almost made an end of me on earth,
    but I have not forsaken your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your steadfast love give me life,
    that I may keep the testimonies of your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For ever, O Lord, your word
    is firmly fixed in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your faithfulness endures to all generations;
    you have established the earth, and it stands fast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By your appointment they stand this day,
    for all things are your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If your law had not been my delight,
    I would have perished in my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will never forget your precepts,
    for by them you have given me life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am yours; save me,
    for I have sought your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked lie in wait to destroy me,
    but I consider your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen a limit to all perfection,
    but your commandment is exceedingly broad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh how I love your law!
    It is my meditation all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commandment makes me wiser than my enemies,
    for it is ever with me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have more understanding than all my teachers,
    for your testimonies are my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I understand more than the aged,
    for I keep your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hold back my feet from every evil way,
    in order to keep your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do not turn aside from your rules,
    for you have taught me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How sweet are your words to my taste,
    sweeter than honey to my mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through your precepts I get understanding;
    therefore I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
    and a light to my path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have sworn an oath and confirmed it,
    to keep your righteous rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am severely afflicted;
    give me life, O Lord, according to your word!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Accept my freewill offerings of praise, O Lord,
    and teach me your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hold my life in my hand continually,
    but I do not forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have laid a snare for me,
    but I do not stray from your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are my heritage for ever,
    for they are the joy of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I incline my heart to perform your statutes
    for ever, to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate the double-minded,
    but I love your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place and my shield;
    I hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from me, you evildoers,
    that I may keep the commandments of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Uphold me according to your promise, that I may live,
    and let me not be put to shame in my hope!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hold me up, that I may be safe
    and have regard for your statutes continually!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You spurn all who go astray from your statutes,
    for their cunning is in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the wicked of the earth you discard like dross,
    therefore I love your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My flesh trembles for fear of you,
    and I am afraid of your judgements.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have done what is just and right;
    do not leave me to my oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give your servant a pledge of good;
    let not the insolent oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes long for your salvation
    and for the fulfilment of your righteous promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deal with your servant according to your steadfast love,
    and teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am your servant; give me understanding,
    that I may know your testimonies!
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is time for the Lord to act,
    for your law has been broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I love your commandments
    above gold, above fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I consider all your precepts to be right;
    I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are wonderful;
    therefore my soul keeps them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The unfolding of your words gives light;
    it imparts understanding to the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I open my mouth and pant,
    because I long for your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
    as is your way with those who love your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep steady my steps according to your promise,
    and let no iniquity get dominion over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Redeem me from man's oppression,
    that I may keep your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make your face shine upon your servant,
    and teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes shed streams of tears,
    because people do not keep your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteous are you, O Lord,
    and right are your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have appointed your testimonies in righteousness
    and in all faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My zeal consumes me,
    because my foes forget your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your promise is well tried,
    and your servant loves it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am small and despised,
    yet I do not forget your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness is righteous for ever,
    and your law is true.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trouble and anguish have found me out,
    but your commandments are my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are righteous for ever;
    give me understanding that I may live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my whole heart I cry; answer me, O Lord!
    I will keep your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I call to you; save me,
    that I may observe your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
    I hope in your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are awake before the watches of the night,
    that I may meditate on your promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my voice according to your steadfast love;
    O Lord, according to your justice give me life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They draw near who persecute me with evil purpose;
    they are far from your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you are near, O Lord,
    and all your commandments are true.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Long have I known from your testimonies
    that you have founded them for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look on my affliction and deliver me,
    for I do not forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Plead my cause and redeem me;
    give me life according to your promise!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
    for they do not seek your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is your mercy, O Lord;
    give me life according to your rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are my persecutors and my adversaries,
    but I do not swerve from your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look at the faithless with disgust,
    because they do not keep your commands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider how I love your precepts!
    Give me life according to your steadfast love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sum of your word is truth,
    and every one of your righteous rules endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Princes persecute me without cause,
    but my heart stands in awe of your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rejoice at your word
    like one who finds great spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate and abhor falsehood,
    but I love your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seven times a day I praise you
    for your righteous rules.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great peace have those who love your law;
    nothing can make them stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hope for your salvation, O Lord,
    and I do your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul keeps your testimonies;
    I love them exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I keep your precepts and testimonies,
    for all my ways are before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my cry come before you, O Lord;
    give me understanding according to your word!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my plea come before you;
    deliver me according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My lips will pour forth praise,
    for you teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My tongue will sing of your word,
    for all your commandments are right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your hand be ready to help me,
    for I have chosen your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I long for your salvation, O Lord,
    and your law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my soul live and praise you,
    and let your rules help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
